case.name: Possession
case.description: Must-target; Nayru is visibly lifted into the air by a dark spirit

trigger.state: I've felt this... no! I-I can...!

markers.marker: Veran has attempted to goad 9S by likening him to a "stunted goron".
Veran comments on being an upgrade to Nayru
Nayru asks an armored opponent to discard the armor. No need for everyone to be asked this individually.
Nayru assesses the table and makes a comment about the sort gathered. She often has no reason to do so repeatedly.
Nayru inquires about just what a bad hand is. Thus, she doesn't need to repeat herself.
The player just lost with a great hand. Done to set up "surprise", and prevent spam.
"Suffer defeat! Know despair!"
Nayru senses an evil like nothing she's felt before.
At Sei's inquiry, Nayru typically refuses a drink. Late enough into the game, however, she may go along with it...
Joey's fakeout just caught her. Used as a failsafe, since Joey's code strips 2 bras.
Marker to remember player gender choice
Nayru comments on someone besides her having blue hair.
The first hand of the game. Used as a failsafe.
Florina has fled during her first strip round.
Veran offers forgiveness during a minor round; this keeps her from getting too angry.
Nayru had commented on her harp. Used to prevent spam.
Nayru recalled that Link once used the harp to save her, her childhood friend Ralph, and the whole land of Labrynna; from Veran, incidentally
Nayru hasn't managed to glimpse Jura's future at all.
Nayru's given a hopeful report to Jura
Nayru's given an optimistic report to Jura
Nayru's refused to give a poor report to Jura
Nayru comments on playing a lullaby, but decides against doing so immediately
Her first line upon finishing; used to ensure the "standing up" pose occurs only once.
Nayru expresses disappointment at how poorly she's doing. (removed minor, male; rounds 5-7
Nayru mistakes Kyu for a Great Fairy during the hand-quality phase
Nayru ignores dire evil, because she's been wrong before.
"Invisible" marker (doesn't change dialogue) to set up the Mahiru snapshot chain. Marker 0 of snapshot chain. Given on the must strip stage.
Intro for Mahiru
Marker 3 of snapshot chain. Given as Nayru asks Mahiru to keep the picture safe. Hand quality phase.
Marker 4 of snapshot chain. Given as Nayru comments on her unfamiliarity with keepsakes in general. Hand quality phase.
Marker 2 of snapshot chain. Given as Nayru says "Keese!"; stripped stage.
Marker 1 of snapshot chain. Given as Nayru asks for a picture; stripping stage.
Marker to remember player gender choice
Keeps Nayru from asking about the Akuma twice.
Veran claims to be present at Nayru's behest; given during a hand-quality phase
Veran claims that Nayru is needed to bring about eternal darkness; given during a hand-quality phase
Nayru gives a line after having finished; used to prevent repetition
Nayru introduces herself to Marinette
Veran asks what sort of magic Marinette has to prevent her; given during a hand-quality phase
Veran gives a line about what this reminds Marinette of, specifically; during her panty strip, of course
Nayru replies that a weight has been lifted; used to prevent spam
Nayru tells Meia that her doubt is understandable; hand quality during Meia's second layer
Nayru suggests that Jura has a surprise for Meia, but refuses to elaborate
Nayru sees something funny, probably at Meia's expense
Nayru introduces herself to Meia
Nayru sees something that scares her, though it could be just daily life for Meia
Marker used to ensure that Nayru finishes the Meia chain if she starts it
Veran's first real line to Meia
Prepares for the Meia song chain. Can be given different string values depending on the song chosen (storms, din, farore, nayru)
Nayru introduces herself to Meia and Jura both (and immediately takes Jura's side)
If Nayru sees the human player strip their important lower before something else, she remembers
Set when Nayru sees a male player preparing to remove their final lower item. If not set when male player crotch is revealed, earlydong is set instead
Nayru introduces herself to Ping
Backup marker, set after must-masturbate, for when Nayru dismisses Veran for her forfeit. May ease targeting to an extent.
Failsafe to ensure that Nayru doesn't call Natsuki "adorable" more than once; here in case I make more lines using this marker in the future
Setup to make target responses simpler; next line Nayru gives will call Natsuki "adorable"
Alternative setup for nat_adorb which only activates while Veran is present
Nayru introduces herself to Natsuki
Nayru asks whether Navi knows the spirit of the hero (that is, any incarnation of Link)
Nayru introduces herself to Navi
Nayru introduces herself to 9s
Nayru is beginning to feel more comfortable, as well as more skilled at the game. If not met, Veran will take over out of shame for Nayru's pitiful display thus far.
Intro for Palutena, sans Pit
Intro for Pit, sans Palutena
The first instance of drawing/swapping after the possession. Veran's first real line.
The first hand while possessed. Prevents spam.
prevents most null-possess markers down the road; set upon possession to allow for future case work
Nayru makes a comment during an early must_masturbate phase about how oracles are above such debasement.
Prepares for the Revy futuresight chain. Stores different values based on Nayru's slightly different reactions.
Nayru introduces herself to Shimakaze
(Invisible) Marker set to telegraph a line for Shimakaze
Nayru alludes to Epona's Song, claiming it causes animals of all sorts to come running (female removing accessory, 0-2)
If an MLP girl is present, Nayru will follow-up her Epona's Song line
Reference to the Great Fairy Fountain theme, a non-magical song (female removing accessory, 3-4)
If a fairy is present, Nayru will ask if the song sounds familiar
During her first four strips, Nayru has a small chance of referencing one of the heroes of legend
If Nayru references a hero of legend, she'll claim that the song is changing even as she sings it
Nayru references Zelda's Lullabye
If Zelda is present, she follows up to ask if the song sounds familiar
Round 1 of the forfeit; currently only used by Veran
It's not a very good story. (Veran, 5-7, female losing minor)
Veran tells a story!
Upon seeing the player's excellent hand, Nayru realizes that the player actually lost with it.
Introduction to Uravity
Sets off the dialogue chain to Uravity during Nayru's first strip
(Invisible) Marker set to enable Veran's forfeit. Determined by level of nudity at the table.
Nayru begins to explain why she lets Veran control her; they've come to an agreement.
Veran's limited in some way by something at the Inventory, so Nayru's always in some amount of control.
But Veran has certain useful skills; like poker.
Technically, if Nayru is possessed, it's not Veran who's playing the game, so...
Maybe Veran has too much fun, but in the end, Nayru always knew what the game entailed.
